last_episode_to_air.name: Survival of the Fittest
last_episode_to_air.overview: Kidnapped by a group of rogue police, four Black activists are forced into a hunt in which they are the prey; the only way that they can survive is for the prey to become the hunters.

name: Tales
overview: A one-hour anthology series that distills classic hip-hop records and reimagines them as cinematic love letters.

episodes.name: F**k The Police
episodes.overview: The premiere episode recreates NWA’s “F*ck the Police,” which focuses on a controversial police shooting of a young boy that flips the biases and stereotypes of today’s society.

episodes.name: Cold Hearted
episodes.overview: Inspired by the lyrics of Meek Mill's "Cold Hearted", this episode explores the life of a mega-star rapper who gets fatally shot, with his faithful sidekick by his side, and all suspects - his wife, manager and best friend.

episodes.name: A Story to Tell
episodes.overview: A woman fed up with her NBA fiance's philandering has an affair with a neighborhood hustler. Inspired by the lyrics of Notorious BIG's "I've Got a Story to Tell."

episodes.name: Trap Queen
episodes.overview: Anthology series of "song stories" weaving classic Hip-Hop and R&B songs into visually stunning narratives with Trap Queen inspired by the Fetty Wap track.

episodes.name: Children's Story
episodes.overview: Inspired by the lyrics of Slick Rick's Children's Story, this episode follows two penniless teenagers who learn the lesson of karma the hard way when they start robbing people in their neighborhood.

episodes.name: 99 Problems
episodes.overview: Inspired by the lyrics of Jay-Z's "99 Problems"; two BLM activist college lovers go on the run to escape the clutches of the police.

episodes.name: You Got Me
episodes.overview: Inspired by the lyrics of The Roots ft. Erykah Badu's "You Got Me"; a highly disciplined dancer, about to perform in an important show, falls for a man who gets her to lose control.

episodes.name: All I Need
episodes.overview: Inspired by the lyrics of Method Man ft. Mary J. Blige's "I'll Be There for You/You're All I Need to Get By", A naive and suicidal prostitute feels trapped in her reckless life of sex and violence. In a desperate attempt to flee her abusive pimp, she finds unexpected love in the arms of a war vet who suffers from PTSD.

episodes.name: Brothers
episodes.overview: A Shakespearean tale of two brothers, each carving out drastically different lifestyles in modern-day Atlanta.

episodes.name: Slippery
episodes.overview: When an Atlanta rap group funded by drug money is targeted by a zealous FBI agent, the rappers and their lawyer must find a way to translate their Machiavellian tactics from the streets to the courtroom in order to beat the case.

episodes.name: My Life
episodes.overview: Recovering addict Edie is a hotel maid who dreams of being a fashion designer, but she has her life turned upside-down when she learns her mother, Clarice, is terminally ill.

episodes.name: Deep Cover
episodes.overview: Explore the underbelly of colliding family members as they go to war over Atlanta's drug game. No one is to be trusted and honor among thieves is the only code to live by.

episodes.name: Bodak Yellow
episodes.overview: Exotic dancer Violet, 23, raises her teenage sister while looking for her shot at becoming a hip-hop superstar.

episodes.name: XO Tour Llif3
episodes.overview: Janelle, the neglected teenage daughter of wealthy lawyers, throws a drug-fueled party while her parents are on a business trip; when her parents return home early to discover their house in disarray, Janelle resorts to drugs to cope with her anger.

episodes.name: My Mind Playing Tricks On Me
episodes.overview: Smooth-talking ladies man Davis uses a Mardi Gras celebration as a hunting ground for a very particular type of woman; Davis lures these women to his enigmatic family home where a series of mysterious occurrences unfold.

episodes.name: I Gave You Power
episodes.overview: Tracking the life cycle of a Desert Eagle handgun as it travels from the factory floor into the hands of the prideful, the weak and the vindictive, giving them all a false sense of power while creating a path of pain and death on city streets.

episodes.name: Ex-Factor
episodes.overview: Powerful female architect Billie is caught up in a love triangle between her soul mate, Micah, and her husband, David, and she is forced to make a decision about whom to be with.

episodes.name: Moonlight
episodes.overview: A romantic fable set in the artistic underbelly of Atlanta with street artist Dario who harbors a beautiful, deep secret and the young woman, Ruby, whom he loves but cannot be with.

episodes.name: Fight the Power
episodes.overview: A passionate lawyer raised by Black Panthers sets out to convict the police officer who murdered a Black girl.

episodes.name: Renee
episodes.overview: An interpretation of the Lost Boyz track "Renee" sees the titular heroine, an idealistic law student, connect with barber Lamar as they try to protect a teen from local drug dealers.

episodes.name: Act Up
episodes.overview: A story of four women's revenge against the men who sold them into slavery; Lola, Camille, Sasha and Julia use every weapon at their disposal to regain the lives stolen from them.

episodes.name: Hot in Here
episodes.overview: Inspired by the lyrics to Nelly's "Hot in Herre," a college professor uses her 30th birthday as a chance to get over her ex and take control of her love life.

episodes.name: C.R.E.A.M.
episodes.overview: In a story inspired by Wu-Tang Clan's "C.R.E.A.M. (Cash Rules Everything Around Me)," a reformed man returns to a life of crime when he needs money for his daughter's lifesaving operation.

episodes.name: Put It on Me
episodes.overview: A young police officer and her undercover boyfriend operate from both sides of the law to find the source of corruption that plagues their city.

episodes.name: Ms. Jackson
episodes.overview: Cheryl Jackson has decided her daughter, Tina's, inheritance money should be hers, and she is going to get her hands on it by any means necessary.

episodes.name: Murder She Wrote
episodes.overview: Hardened by prison, tutored by a master criminal, Zena returns home for payback against those who murdered her fiancée and threw her in prison; using her beauty as a weapon, she maneuvers her enemies into a showdown.

episodes.name: Jesus Walks
episodes.overview: Jewel leads a double life of Church choir angel by day, aspiring pop star by night; as her worlds in the church and the street head towards their inevitable collision, her belief in herself, her choices in life and her faith face a test.

episodes.name: Survival of the Fittest
episodes.overview: Kidnapped by a group of rogue police, four Black activists are forced into a hunt in which they are the prey; the only way that they can survive is for the prey to become the hunters.
